metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9839 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In MapServer before 7.0.3, OGR driver error messages are too verbose and may leak sensitive information if data connection fails.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgi-mapserver - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
libmapscript-java - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
libmapscript-perl - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
libmapserver2 - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
mapserver-bin - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
python-mapscript - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
ruby-mapscript - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mapserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1').
